questions.question: What is Vagrant?
options: A type of bird
A configuration management tool
A programming language
A tool for managing virtualized development environments

questions.question: What does Vagrant use for creating and configuring virtual environments?
options: Shell scripts
Bash commands
Puppet
Vagrantfiles

questions.question: What are the key benefits of using Vagrant?
options: Reduced system resource usage
Simplified environment setup and consistency
Enhanced graphics performance
Built-in version control

questions.question: What is a 'Vagrant Box'?
options: A storage container for files
A virtual machine template
A programming construct in Vagrantfiles
A network interface in virtual environments

questions.question: What is 'Vagrantfile'?
options: A file format for storing virtual machine images
A configuration file written in YAML that defines Vagrant environments
A script for creating Docker containers
A command line tool for managing Vagrant boxes

questions.question: What is 'provisioning' in Vagrant?
options: The process of setting up a virtual machine
The act of deploying web applications
The process of compressing Vagrant boxes
The process of creating virtual networks

questions.question: What is 'vagrant up'?
options: A command for shutting down a virtual machine
A command for updating Vagrant to the latest version
A command for creating and starting a virtual machine
A command for sharing Vagrant boxes

questions.question: What is 'vagrant halt'?
options: A command for pausing a virtual machine
A command for deleting a virtual machine
A command for stopping a virtual machine
A command for restarting a virtual machine

questions.question: What is 'vagrant destroy'?
options: A command for shutting down a virtual machine
A command for deleting a virtual machine
A command for pausing a virtual machine
A command for updating Vagrant to the latest version

questions.question: What is 'vagrant reload'?
options: A command for restarting a virtual machine
A command for updating Vagrant to the latest version
A command for creating and starting a virtual machine
A command for shutting down and starting up a virtual machine

questions.question: What is 'vagrant status'?
options: A command for listing all available Vagrant boxes
A command for displaying the current state of Vagrant environments
A command for showing virtual machine performance statistics
A command for displaying network status in virtual environments

questions.question: What is 'vagrant ssh'?
options: A command for creating a secure shell session into a virtual machine
A command for sharing Vagrant boxes
A command for stopping a virtual machine
A command for displaying Vagrant box details

questions.question: What is 'vagrant plugin'?
options: A command for updating Vagrant plugins
A command for installing and managing Vagrant plugins
A command for listing available Vagrant plugins
A command for sharing Vagrant boxes

questions.question: What is 'vagrant snapshot'?
options: A command for taking screenshots of virtual machines
A command for creating copies of virtual machine states
A command for sharing Vagrant boxes
A command for managing network snapshots

questions.question: What is 'vagrant share'?
options: A command for sharing Vagrant boxes over a network
A command for creating public URLs to access Vagrant environments
A command for sharing Vagrant snapshots
A command for managing network sharing settings

questions.question: What is 'vagrant box add'?
options: A command for creating a new Vagrant box
A command for updating Vagrant boxes
A command for adding a new Vagrant box to the list of available boxes
A command for listing available Vagrant boxes

questions.question: What is 'vagrant box remove'?
options: A command for removing a Vagrant box
A command for updating Vagrant boxes
A command for adding a new Vagrant box to the list of available boxes
A command for listing available Vagrant boxes

questions.question: What is 'vagrant box list'?
options: A command for listing all available Vagrant boxes
A command for updating Vagrant boxes
A command for adding a new Vagrant box to the list of available boxes
A command for removing a Vagrant box

questions.question: What is 'vagrant global-status'?
options: A command for displaying Vagrant environments globally
A command for listing all available Vagrant boxes
A command for updating Vagrant boxes globally
A command for managing global settings in Vagrant

questions.question: What is 'vagrant suspend'?
options: A command for stopping a virtual machine
A command for shutting down a virtual machine
A command for suspending a virtual machine
A command for restarting a virtual machine

questions.question: What is 'vagrant resume'?
options: A command for restarting a virtual machine
A command for resuming a suspended virtual machine
A command for updating Vagrant to the latest version
A command for creating and starting a virtual machine

questions.question: What is 'vagrant init'?
options: A command for initializing a new Vagrant environment
A command for updating Vagrant to the latest version
A command for creating a new Vagrant box
A command for adding a new Vagrant box to the list of available boxes

questions.question: What is 'vagrant validate'?
options: A command for validating Vagrant environments
A command for checking the syntax of Vagrantfiles
A command for updating Vagrant to the latest version
A command for validating Vagrant boxes

questions.question: What is 'vagrant ssh-config'?
options: A command for configuring SSH settings for virtual machines
A command for sharing SSH keys with Vagrant boxes
A command for displaying the SSH configuration of Vagrant environments
A command for managing SSH settings in Vagrant

questions.question: What is 'vagrant port'?
options: A command for displaying network port settings of Vagrant environments
A command for managing port forwarding in virtual machines
A command for updating Vagrant to the latest version
A command for sharing Vagrant boxes over a network
